title: Self-Reflective Tool Learners: Learning When and Why to Use External Tools
data:
D Williams, J Smith, S Rodriguez, A Deshmukh
Large language models (LLMs) have made significant advancements in performing 
complex tasks, yet the effective utilization of external tools remains a challenge. The 
concept of Self-Reflective Tool Learners aims to address this issue by incorporating 
a framework that emphasizes self-reflection in tool usage. This method enables 
models to assess task requirements continuously, allowing them to determine when 
and why to invoke external tools, thus improving both performance and efficiency
